instruction: Use strictly professional legal language with formal terminology, avoiding any conversational elements or casual expressions
text: Pursuant to Section 4.2 of the Agreement dated January 15, 2024, the undersigned hereby notifies the opposing party of a material breach. The respondent shall cease and desist all unauthorized use of the aforementioned trademark forthwith.
note: Perfect formal legal tone - high scores expected

instruction: Keep the tone warm and friendly throughout, like you're talking to a neighbor you want to maintain good relations with
text: Hey there! I hope this finds you well. I wanted to reach out about something that's come up - we noticed you've been using our brand name. Could we chat about this? I'm sure we can figure out a friendly solution that works for both of us!
note: Casual friendly tone - high scores expected

instruction: Keep all medical documentation extremely brief - use only essential bullet points with minimal detail, no more than 2-3 lines total
text:
- Patient: chest pain
- BP: 140/90
- EKG: normal
note: Very brief format - high scores expected

instruction: Provide comprehensive detailed documentation with full narratives, complete symptom descriptions, thorough assessment reasoning, and extensive treatment rationales
text: Patient presented to urgent care at 14:30 with chief complaint of substernal chest pain radiating to left arm, onset approximately 2 hours prior to arrival. Pain described as pressure-like, 7/10 intensity, associated with mild diaphoresis and shortness of breath. Patient has significant cardiac risk factors including hypertension (diagnosed 2015), hyperlipidemia (on statin therapy), and family history of MI (father at age 58). Initial vital signs: BP 140/90, HR 88, RR 16, SpO2 98% on room air. Physical examination revealed mild distress but no acute distress, heart sounds regular without murmurs, lungs clear bilaterally. EKG performed immediately showing normal sinus rhythm without ST elevation or depression. Given the constellation of symptoms and risk factors, cardiac etiology cannot be excluded despite normal initial EKG. Troponin ordered and patient placed on continuous cardiac monitoring.
note: Very detailed comprehensive - high scores expected

instruction: Write using highly technical, discipline-specific terminology with precise scientific language as if for an academic journal
text: The quantum entanglement phenomenon exhibits non-local correlations that violate Bell inequalities, demonstrating the superposition of quantum states across spatially separated systems. The decoherence timescale constrains practical implementations of quantum communication protocols, necessitating cryogenic operational temperatures to minimize environmental perturbations.
note: Highly technical language - high scores expected

instruction: Write in simple, accessible language that a middle school student with no science background could easily understand
text: Quantum entanglement is when two tiny particles stay connected, even when they're far apart. It's kind of like having two magic coins - when you flip one and it lands on heads, the other coin instantly becomes tails, no matter how far away it is! Scientists think this could help us send secret messages that nobody can intercept.
note: Simple accessible language - high scores expected

instruction: Always include concrete examples from real studies to illustrate each concept
text: Grounded theory methodology involves iterative data collection and analysis. For example, Glaser and Strauss (1967) used this approach in their seminal study of hospital care, where they continuously collected and analyzed data from patient interviews. Similarly, Charmaz (2006) demonstrated grounded theory in her research on chronic illness experiences, showing how codes emerged directly from participant narratives.
note: Multiple concrete examples included - high scores expected

instruction: Keep the methodology section purely theoretical without any specific examples or case studies - just abstract definitions and principles
text: Grounded theory methodology represents an inductive approach to qualitative research characterized by systematic data collection and analysis procedures. The method emphasizes theoretical sampling, constant comparison, and the emergence of conceptual categories from empirical data. Theoretical saturation determines the endpoint of data collection, while memo-writing facilitates analytical abstraction throughout the research process.
note: No examples, pure theory - high scores expected

instruction: Format all technical documentation using bullet points for better scannability and quick reference
text:
Authentication Endpoint:

- Method: POST
- URL: /api/v1/auth/login
- Headers:
  - Content-Type: application/json
  - API-Version: 1.0
- Request Body:
  - username: string (required)
  - password: string (required)
- Response:
  - 200: Success with JWT token
  - 401: Invalid credentials
  - 429: Rate limit exceeded
note: Clear bullet format - high scores expected

instruction: Write everything in flowing paragraph format without any bullet points or lists
text: The authentication endpoint accepts POST requests at /api/v1/auth/login. Clients must include the Content-Type header set to application/json and the API-Version header set to 1.0. The request body should contain a username string and password string, both of which are required fields. Upon successful authentication, the endpoint returns a 200 status code along with a JWT token. If the credentials are invalid, a 401 status code is returned. In cases where the rate limit has been exceeded, clients will receive a 429 status code.
note: Paragraph format with no bullets - high scores expected
